intro: Sedum ellipticum, commonly known as the elliptic stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features fleshy, elliptical leaves that are typically green or reddish in color, arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or white during the summer months. It is well adapted to rocky and arid environments, thriving in full sun and well-drained soil. Sedum ellipticum is often used in rock gardens and as a decorative ground cover due to its hardiness and low maintenance requirements.
